alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 5:47PM MDT until June 16 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. South Platte River near Weldona affecting Morgan and Weld Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South Platte River near Weldona. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM MDT Monday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 8.0 feet early tomorrow morning then to a crest of 8.7 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
